meanings.definition: To impose a tax or levy on (someone or something).
meanings.sent1: The government tallaged the citizens to collect funds for public projects.
meanings.sent2: The city council decided to tallage all properties to improve the local infrastructure.
meanings.sent3: The idea of being tallaged for owning a pet seemed amusing to the young boy.
meanings.sent4: The heavy rain tallaged the roof, causing leaks to spring up everywhere.
meanings.sent5: The king tallaged the merchants heavily, squeezing every last coin from their pockets.

meanings.definition: Subject to a tax or levy.
meanings.sent1: The tallaged goods were marked with a special label at the market.
meanings.sent2: The tallaged properties had to pay an additional fee for maintenance.
meanings.sent3: The tallaged cupcakes looked extra special with the added tax sprinkles.
meanings.sent4: The tallaged car stood out among the untaxed vehicles in the parking lot.
meanings.sent5: The tallaged items on the shelf had higher prices due to the imposed tax.

meanings.sent1: The tallaged products were priced higher than the untaxed ones.
meanings.sent2: The tallaged income was carefully recorded by the accountant.
meanings.sent3: The tallaged candy bars seemed to have an extra sweet tax flavor.
meanings.sent4: The tallaged properties were easily identified by the tax collectors.
meanings.sent5: The tallaged goods had a special mark indicating the imposed tax.
